name: Introductory Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of physics. Students will learn about mechanics, heat and thermodynamics, waves and sound, and electricity and magnetism.

name: Modern Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of modern physics. Students will learn about special relativity, quantum mechanics, atomic physics, and nuclear physics.

name: Mathematical Methods for Physicists
description: This course covers the mathematical methods commonly used in physics. Topics covered include vector calculus, differential equations, linear algebra, and complex analysis.

name: Classical Mechanics
description: This course covers classical mechanics. Topics covered include Newtonian mechanics, Lagrangian mechanics, Hamiltonian mechanics, and the calculus of variations.

name: Electromagnetism
description: This course covers electromagnetism. Topics covered include electrostatics, magnetism, electromagnetic waves, and Maxwell's equations.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: This course covers quantum mechanics. Topics covered include wave-particle duality, the Schr√∂dinger equation, angular momentum, and the hydrogen atom.

name: Thermodynamics and Statistical Mechanics
description: This course covers thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Topics covered include the laws of thermodynamics, the free energy, entropy, and the statistical interpretation of thermodynamics.

name: Solid State Physics
description: This course covers the properties of solids. Topics covered include crystal structures, electronic band theory, phonons, and defects in crystals.

name: Condensed Matter Physics
description: This course covers condensed matter physics. Topics covered include superconductivity, magnetism, electronic properties of metals and semiconductors, and surface physics.
